parameters.pythonCode:
# Get the raw HTML arrays from HTML1
titles_raw = _input.first().json.get('titles', [])
urls_raw = _input.first().json.get('urls', [])
dates_raw = _input.first().json.get('dates', [])

print(f"Raw input - titles: {len(titles_raw)}, urls: {len(urls_raw)}, dates: {len(dates_raw)}")

# Track unique URLs
seen_urls = set()
articles = []

# Process each URL
for i in range(len(urls_raw)):
    url = urls_raw[i] if i < len(urls_raw) else ''
    
    # Skip if not an article URL or already seen
    if not url.startswith('/ai/'):
        continue
    if url in seen_urls:
        continue
    if len(url) < 15:  # Too short to be real article
        continue
        
    seen_urls.add(url)
    
    # Create title from URL slug
    slug = url.split('/')[-1]
    title = slug.replace('-', ' ').title()  # Better capitalization
    
    # Get date
    date = dates_raw[i] if i < len(dates_raw) else 'October 2025'
    
    # Create article item
    articles.append({
        'json': {
            'title': title,
            'url': 'https://venturebeat.com' + url,
            'date': date,
            'source': 'VentureBeat',
            'source_priority': 2
        }
    })

print(f"Filtered to {len(articles)} unique articles")

return articles

# Get the arrays from the input
titles = _input.first().json.get('titles', [])
urls = _input.first().json.get('urls', [])
dates = _input.first().json.get('dates', [])

# Create individual article items with proper n8n format
articles = []

for i in range(len(titles)):
    articles.append({
        'json': {
            'title': titles[i] if i < len(titles) else '',
            'url': urls[i] if i < len(urls) else '',
            'date': dates[i] if i < len(dates) else '',
            'source': 'TechCrunch',
            'index': i
        }
    })

# Return the articles
return articles

# Get all input items
items = _input.all()

# Funding keywords
strong_keywords = [
    'raised', 'raises', 'raising',
    'secures funding', 'closes funding',
    'announces funding', 'lands funding',
    'funding round', 'investment round',
    'series a', 'series b', 'series c',
    'seed round', 'pre-seed'
]

money_keywords = ['million', 'billion', '$', 'usd']
support_keywords = ['funding', 'investment', 'investors', 'valuation', 'round', 'backs', 'leads']

# Filter funding articles
funding_articles = []

for item in items:
    # Safely get title and URL, convert to string
    title = str(item.json.get('title', ''))
    url = str(item.json.get('url', ''))
    
    # Convert to lowercase
    title = title.lower()
    url = url.lower()
    combined = title + ' ' + url
    
    # Count matches
    strong_count = sum(1 for kw in strong_keywords if kw in combined)
    money_count = sum(1 for kw in money_keywords if kw in combined)
    support_count = sum(1 for kw in support_keywords if kw in combined)
    
    # Check if funding
    is_funding = (strong_count >= 1) or (money_count >= 1 and support_count >= 1)
    
    if is_funding:
        funding_articles.append({'json': item.json})

print(f"Filtered from {len(items)} to {len(funding_articles)} funding articles")

# Return all funding articles
return funding_articles

# Industry taxonomy with keywords
industries = {
    'Healthcare & Life Sciences AI': [
        'healthcare', 'medical', 'biotech', 'health tech', 
        'pharma', 'clinical', 'patient', 'diagnosis',
        'drug discovery', 'telemedicine', 'hospital', 'doctor'
    ],
    'FinTech & Financial Services AI': [
        'fintech', 'banking', 'payment', 'finance', 
        'lending', 'crypto', 'blockchain', 'trading',
        'fraud detection', 'insurance', 'credit', 'wallet'
    ],
    'Climate Tech & Sustainability': [
        'climate', 'carbon', 'renewable', 'energy',
        'sustainability', 'green tech', 'solar', 'wind',
        'emissions', 'esg', 'waste', 'recycling', 'environment'
    ],
    'Transportation & Mobility AI': [
        'transportation', 'vehicle', 'autonomous', 'self-driving',
        'mobility', 'fleet', 'logistics', 'delivery', 'automotive',
        'car', 'truck', 'inspection'
    ],
    'Enterprise Software & Automation': [
        'enterprise', 'b2b', 'saas', 'automation',
        'productivity', 'workflow', 'business intelligence',
        'operations', 'analytics'
    ],
    'Robotics & Hardware': [
        'robotics', 'robot', 'hardware', 'manufacturing',
        'warehouse', 'automation hardware', 'machinery',
        'sorting', 'facilities'
    ],
    'EdTech & Learning': [
        'education', 'edtech', 'learning', 'student',
        'school', 'university', 'training', 'mycroft'
    ],
    'Consumer & Retail AI': [
        'consumer', 'retail', 'e-commerce', 'shopping',
        'marketplace', 'lifestyle', 'entertainment'
    ],
    'Developer Tools & Infrastructure': [
        'developer', 'devops', 'infrastructure', 'cloud',
        'api', 'platform', 'software development'
    ]
}

# Get article data
title = str(_input.item.json.get('title', ''))
url = str(_input.item.json.get('url', ''))
combined = (title + ' ' + url).lower()

# Score each industry
industry_matches = []

for industry, keywords in industries.items():
    score = 0
    matched_keywords = []
    
    for keyword in keywords:
        if keyword in combined:
            score += 1
            matched_keywords.append(keyword)
    
    if score > 0:
        industry_matches.append({
            'industry': industry,
            'score': score,
            'keywords': matched_keywords
        })

# Sort by score (highest first)
industry_matches.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True)

# Get primary and secondary industries
primary = industry_matches[0] if industry_matches else None
secondary = industry_matches[1:3] if len(industry_matches) > 1 else []

# Return with classification
return {
    'json': {
        **_input.item.json,
        'primary_industry': primary['industry'] if primary else 'General AI',
        'primary_industry_score': primary['score'] if primary else 0,
        'primary_keywords': primary['keywords'] if primary else [],
        'secondary_industries': [s['industry'] for s in secondary],
        'all_industry_matches': industry_matches,
        'classification_complete': True
    }
}
